content: vivaldi spring mitts spring is the first pair of mitts in the four seasons collection a tangle of leaves and tender shoots reach for the sun with buds ready to burst forth on the back of the hand and stockinette on the palm the lace pattern is rhythmic and easy to memorize it is written for magic loop but could easily be adapted for dpns please do not copy distribute or sell this pattern in any form grace anne knits 2025 to determine your size wrap a flexible measuring tape around your hand below the knuckles excluding your thumb sizes tiny 7 5 smallish 8 0 larger 8 5 materials tiny fingering yarn 150 - 200 yards us 2 2 75mm 32 circular needle smallish sport/dk yarn 150 200 yards us 4 3 5mm 32 circular needle larger worsted yarn 150 200 yards us 6 4 0mm 32 circular needle notions 1 locking stitch marker 1 additional marker waste yarn and a tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations co - cast on using the backward loop method k - knit k1tbl - knit 1 through the back loop k2tog - knit 2 together gracianne designs kfb - knit into the front and back of the same stitch mb - make bobble *** p - purl pm - place marker sm - slip marker ssk - slip 1 knitwise slip 1 knitwise knit slipped stitches together through the back loop sts -stitches yo - yarn over *** cocoknits has a great tutorial for knitting 3 stitch bobbles without turning your work easy-peasy https //cocoknits com/blogs/knit-tutorials/how-to-knit-bobbles-without-turning-your-work this pattern is for private use only it may not be copied sold or otherwise distributed you also cannot sell any items produced in accordance with the instructions contained in this pattern without first contacting the author of the pattern 1 right mitt twisted rib cuff cast on 48 sts using a stretchy cast on method and divide evenly onto needle 1 and needle 2 being careful not to twist prepare to join and work in the round place a unique stitch marker to indicate the beginning of the round k1tbl p1 for 10 rounds right wrist work rounds1 - 24 of lace chart lace leaves encircle the entire wrist so rounds 1 24 are each worked twice once per needle 1 & needle 2 right hand/thumb from this point forward the back of the hand needle 1 is worked from lace chart rounds 25-48 the palm needle 2 is worked in stockinette with thumb shaping needle 1 needle 2 round 25 work chart row 25 kfb kfb pm k1tbl p3 k13 p3 k1tbl p1 round 26 work chart row 26 k4 sm k1tbl p3 k13 p3 k1tbl p1 round 27 work chart row 27 k4 sm k1tbl p3 k13 p3 k1tbl p1 round 28 work chart row 28 k4 sm k1tbl p3 k13 p3 k1tbl p1 round 29 work chart row 29 kfb k2 kfb sm k1tbl p3 k13 p3 k1tbl p1 round 30
